title: Senior Account Director
content:
At Media.Monks, we are recruiting a digital-savvy go-getter who will manage business accounts at the intersection of creativity and technology.
Role & Responsibilities

As a Business Monk at the biggest creative production company on the planet, you are the first point of contact for our clients, who seek MediaMonks for the strategy, creative and production of their digital briefs.
You’ll be the client’s main point of contact for day-to-day activities, managing new projects from start to finish, inputting on strategic recommendations, championing best-in-class creative, and overseeing 360 campaign delivery. 
The work is centred around creating innovative digital work across the customer decision journey, working on both product launches and brand campaigns.
You are responsible for key project financial activities and reporting. Delivering against monthly and annual targets, you help to grow business accounts into a long-term success for all parties.
You will be viewed as one of the leaders of the P&G team and will be responsible for focusing and directing a team of up to 20 across multiple disciplines.
You are responsible for client communications, working across various brands within large global businesses, making sure the work being produced exceeds the client’s expectations.
Delivering against monthly and annual targets, you help to grow business accounts into a long-term success for all parties.

Requirements:

This key role requires someone with 5+ years experience managing business accounts in B2C digital, social or advertising, you are a safe pair of hands, you take initiative and you have a proven track record managing high-value and volumes of interdisciplinary work.
You have previous senior experience running large scale 360 campaigns including retail, either in FMCG or technology-based products.
You are a natural leader who is able to command and focus the agency team, make decisions to drive projects forward and manage escalations both internally and externally.
You are organised and on top of your numbers. You are proficient in excel and google sheets and comfortable to manage estimates and budgetary discussions. You can learn how to use various software platforms quickly.  
You are detailed oriented and used to leading and acting on Stewardship and Leadership processes that are expected of the agency.
You love to strategise and have extensive experience writing proposals and can propose solutions from either a basic technical or a creative/commercial perspective.
With the backing of our producers and program management team, you need to be confident in managing the client on digital production projects in a fast-paced environment.
You love to geek out when it comes to new technologies because while managing relationships is your foremost responsibility, you’ve got to grasp technology in a way that allows you to help scope and propose target-driving quotes and timings.
You will have high levels of experience in presenting and negotiating creative ideas and development.
Excellent understanding of the use of and role of social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn) and keeps on top of new features and platforms.
You are an outgoing, sociable individual, ready and willing to get stuck in with the team. You know how to rally and inspire the team when times are tough but also celebrate the successes when they are deserved!
You can work in English at the highest professional level.
About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
